page.title: 09GIDDINGS TIMBER YARD
page.content: The Timber Yard was established in 1928. They now have 110 men employed. They work from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m., five days a week. They sell pallets, packing cases, fencing panels, sawn fencing materials and golden larch. Between 100 - 120 tonnes of wood arrives at the yard every day. Timber is imported ready sawn from Sweden and Portugal. 40% of the timber used is home grown. There is a 45% wastage rate and leftovers include 20 tonnes of sawdust, 10 tonnes of bark and 20 tonnes of off-cuts - all per day. Some of the sawdust is sold to farms for the bottom of animal pens. Giddings hire two articulated lorries to carry the timber. They mainly use softwood coniferous trees like spruce. The yard covers 11 acres.
